Communication switching allows computers to transfer data using shared communication lines like cables. It works similarly to telephone switching networks, eliminating the need to connect each device directly. Instead, devices connect to a central switch that manages connections between them.  

This makes it efficient to transfer data between many devices, as opposed to needing a dedicated line for each connection.
